instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
Hey info, this mac suffered oxidation in the region of the u2600 and SMC, I replaced the oxidized components, but the fan does not rotate. 
    I replaced the u2600, SMC, u7400 and y2605.
Voltage: 
PPbus 12.59
PP3v3_42 3.5V
PPVRTC_G3H 3.31V
ALL_Sys 0V, no pulse.
PLT_rstv 0V, no pulse 
PP3v3_sus 3.31V
PP3v3_s0 3.31`V
PP5v_s0 5.088V
SMC_BATLOW_L 3.29V
PM_SUS_EN 3.31V
PM_SLP_SUS_L 3.31V
PP3V3_S5 3.31V
PCH_INTVRMEN_L 3.073V
RTC_RESET_L 3.31V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.46V

R7403/2 182K / 152K

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
If you get 3V3/5V_S0 voltages, then you should get voltage on all big coils.

Check R7402/03.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="iClub, post: 73488, member: 24223"]
R7403 / 2 182k / 152K
[/QUOTE]
Check R7402/03.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
And you get CPU core voltage???
You are the first interested to post information here.
Check if any coil misses voltage.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
What about L7700/60/70?

L7550/60 (iGPU) only get voltage under high graphics load.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
"L7760 0.536V"
There must be 1.8V, fix the problem.
Check first diode mode to ground.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
diode: L7760 0.170V

I removed the U2600 and U7760, but it still shows this 0.170V diode-scale value.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message: In that case, is the PCH dead?

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
Put them back.
Post U7760 voltages.

All our help is based on schematics...

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
I have suspended the components around, it now shows 1.8V on the L7760 coil, but the fan does not turn.
    I noticed that in the thermal camera the component u3900 gets hot.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
Which voltages appear on the coils?
What about ALL_SYS_PWRGD?

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
"L7100 10mV"
This voltage must appear before VCORE.

Post U7100 voltages; pins 15, 19, 20.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
You still have a problem around U7100.
Check all components, solders and traces.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message: I have replaced the surrounding components, in tests it shows the same defect. The u7100 and the surrounding components are ok.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message: Maybe corroded trace, you STILL have a problem on that power supply.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
I had the same problem  that OP. I changed u7100 and nothing changed. Afterwrds I replaced  Q7100 and it turned on, but, there is something that  always keeps on harming the Q7100 . 

it turns on, but when I connect the screen or the speaker the Q7100 breaks again.

When it was on , it booted ( Q7510-Q7520 = 0.75 V)


Any ideas?

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message: Check/replace R/C7130...

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message: I already checked and R7130 is fine and C7130 measures the same as the same capacitor from another good board

threads.title: 820-3115 green light, no fan/no power
threads.message:
Did you check the capacitor in capacitance mode?
Is so dificult to change it?
